subject: Re: Valentine's Day-related interactives
body:
On Feb. 09, at 09:01 PM, Forrest Wickman wrote:
Curious what others think, but these two are probably my favorite:
  • Calculator: Prescribe a rom com to fix your relationship woes.
  • For each sex position, select the name that Cosmo hasn't given it over the years.

From: <Bloomer>, Jeffrey <Jeffrey.Bloomer@slate.com>
Date: Monday, February 9, 2015 at 6:04 PM
To: Chris Kirk <chris.kirk@slate.com>, Browbeat <browbeat@slate.com>
Cc: Slate Interactives <slateinteractives@slate.com>
Subject: Re: Valentine's Day-related interactives

​When I was at Nerve, making fun of Cosmo sex tips was a Prudie-sized portion of our traffic. Never gets old. 


From: Kirk, Chris
Sent: Monday, February 9, 2015 5:59 PM
To: Browbeat
Cc: Slate Interactives
Subject: Valentine's Day-related interactives
 
Browbeat et al. — Let me know if you would like to see any of these ideas happen this week!

Quizzes:
  • Match the politician to the sext / sexually explicit message, e.g. Anthony Weiner, John Edwards, Warren Harding.
  • Match the sex position to the name Cosmo has given it. Or: For each sex position, select the name that Cosmo hasn't given it over the years.
  • Pick the fake Cosmo sex tip.
  • For each cynical interpretation of a real rom com, name the rom com.
  • Match the moaning to the movie (audio quiz). Or: Match the sex scene transcription to the movie.
  • Guess which celebrities dated a long time ago (see this Tumblr).
  • For each love song a celebrity wrote about another celebrity, guess who it was about (e.g. Taylor Swift's "Dear John" = John Mayer).

Other:
  • Rom com bingo.
  • Virtual sex dice. After a few rolls, the results turn nonsensical, dark, or extremely boring.
  • Calculator: Prescribe a rom com to fix your relationship woes.
  • Calculator: Which Cosmo sex tip should we try? Questions include: "Can you dislocate your arm with ease?" "Do you have pepper at hand?" "Do you enjoy eating body paint?"
